Reviews.Title: Not quite what I expected
Reviews.Author: bob
Reviews.Content: The specs for the phone stated "multi-language".  I didn't even think to ask in which languages it did its menus until after I received it.  It turns out it had English, Spanish & Portuguese.  I needed Italian & German.In light of that, I basically could not use it.I did feel that the touch screen was too insensitive for comfortable use.... my comparison was Atrix & iPhone.The company was great in handling the return and refund.  I would definitely do business with them again.

Reviews.Title: Cheated on the warranty
Reviews.Author: george
Reviews.Content: Phone is okay, but only lasted 4 months.Motorola won't honour the warranty, don't expect any service as they try and distance themselves from dual sim phones once they have your money.

Reviews.Title: Versatile /comprehensive cell phone
Reviews.Author: Ashraf
Reviews.Content: I used this phone during my recent visit to Pakistan. It worked perfect right out of the box. The vendor even send me flat pin plug for charging here in the USA.Overall a good buy!!

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX128.. a good product but not great!
Reviews.Author: Eustace E. Musgrove "Eustace jr,"
Reviews.Content: Not as user friendly as I would have hoped for. Requires too many taps to respond at times. Freezes up quite often and have to reboot in order to exit some menu options.

Reviews.Title: not for big hands
Reviews.Author: Timothy Moore
Reviews.Content: Phone worked great for 100 days then started giving me trouble and has been shipped to Motorola to get fixed. the touch screen is small and hard to operate. If you have large hands this phone is not for you

Reviews.Title: it works only in china
Reviews.Author: Vickie wu
Reviews.Content: don't buy it. battery only works 2 hrs. don't support any apps in U.S. memory only give you name card. if there is 0 point. it got it.

Reviews.Title: Didnt last long enough
Reviews.Author: W. J. Masnyk "Oswegosailor"
Reviews.Content: I loved this phone when I traveled throughout Asia....could keep multiple country sim cards in and just switch when I got off a plane.  The touch screen just suddenly quit working....good luck trying to get it fixed.

Reviews.Title: Motorola EX128 - No Internet Connection
Reviews.Author: Ted
Reviews.Content: This phone seems good especially if you want only the dual sim function. I wanted to use other services like Internet. Unfortunately, i wasted my money on this phone. Not just that I bought the phone, but i paid for unlimited talk, text and data with my mobile carrier. I have tried asking for help from my mobile carrier and Motorola too, but no solution. Does someone know how to get internet connection with this phone??? This description of this phone said email included. But I can not get any connection even though i tried Motorola customer services on phone. When I take out my sim card and place it in another phone, the internet service works, but it won't work with this phone. Either the seller has to tell me how to get internet connection with this phone or i'll consider this seller as lying to customer in order to sell its products. Too bad!See below the Technical Details associated with this phone on this website that made me to buy the phone. But Internet does not work with this phone. If you need Internet on your phone, then DON'T buy this phone!!  ("This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.  Motorola,Quadband,Bluetooth,Touch Screen, Dual Sim  Dual SIM Standby, Stereo FM radio with RDS,  MP3/WAV/eAAC+ player,Organizer,Voice memo,  Predictive text input,SMS, MMS, Email, memory Card slot")

Reviews.Title: GOOD PHONE
Reviews.Author: SODAK
Reviews.Content: IN A LITTLE WORDS THE MOTOROLA EX128 IS A VERY GOOD PHONE, THE SPECIAL OF THIS CELL IS THE DUAL SIM slot, FOR TWO DIFFERENT CARRIERS. THE PHONE WORKS FINE!!!

Reviews.Title: Not a smartphone.
Reviews.Author: Dany Seg
Reviews.Content: No es un smartphone. Partamos de allí. Para compararlo con un smartphone debemos gastar varios cientos de dólares más. Lo compre por ser un teléfono dual simcard, no chino, no marca X. Y realmente no tiene mayores pretensiones. Como tal cumple. Cosas que le he encontrado:Después de leer un msm se pierde la información de por cual simcard entró.No todas las funciones trabajan con el touch, a veces hay que dar clic en la barra inferior.Nunca lo manipule mientras conduzca, se requieren dos manos, varios clics y mucha atención para responder una llamada perdida.Por tener doble simcard algunas operaciones requieren muchos clics.Cuando se empareja con un speaker bluetooth, queda bloqueado para otras opciones, al intentar ir a cualquier menú se interrumpe el bluetooth. Malo esto.Lo tengo hace dos meses y no logro que funcione con mi simcard de internet móvil. Mi idea era tener una simcard para internet y otra para voz porque me favorecen los contratos, pero nada. Tengo dos simcard para voz y el internet móvil solo para uso con PC.La batería tiene buena duración teniendo en cuenta que posee una pantalla grande.El tamaño y el diseño me gustan.3 Megapixeles, pero las fotos quedan oscuras y poco nítidas, aun a plena luz del día. Mi viejo Nokia de 1.3 Mpixeles toma mejores fotos.Al hablar, muchas veces se escucha un zumbido. El interlocutor se escucha claro y fuerte, pero el zumbido molesta.Cables: El jack universal de 3.5 es gran ventaja, muy bueno. El cargados con plug fácil de conseguir. Bien.Sincronización a PC: Mala, se sincroniza para datos, con la tarjeta de memoria, pero no viene ni he conseguido los controladores para sincronizar el teléfono. Mis contactos están en riesgo.Es un aparato para hablar y tener la comodidad de doble simcard en un solo aparato y utilidades de norma: tarjeta de expansión, bluetooth, cámara, radio. No pretenda más que eso.Sí quiere otra cosa, compre otra cosa. Le costará más $$$.Algunos teléfonos chinos tienen el mismo desempeño y tienen TV y WiFi !!!! Por el mismo precio.Not a smartphone. Let's start from there. To compare this with a smartphone should spend several hundred dollars more. I bought it because it is a dual simcard phone, no Chinese, no brand X. And it really has no further claims. As such compliance. Things that I found:After reading a msm is lost simcard information which came by.Not all functions work with the touch, sometimes you have to click on the bottom bar.Never handle while driving, it takes two hands, a few clicks and attention to respond to a missed call.By having dual simcard some operations require many clicks.When paired with a bluetooth speaker, is blocked for other options, trying to go to any menu is cut off bluetooth. That bad.I have it two months ago and I can not work with my simcard mobile internet. My idea was to have a simcard for internet and another for voice because I favor the contracts, but nothing. I have two simcard for voice and mobile internet use with PC only.The battery life is good considering it has a big screen.The size and design I like.3 Megapixels, but the photos are dark and not very sharp, even in broad daylight. My old Nokia from 1.3 Mpixels take better pictures.When speaking, many times you hear a buzz. The caller is heard loud and clear, but the annoying buzz.Cables: The universal jack advantage of 3.5 is very good. The plug loaded with easy to achieve. Good.PC Sync: Mala, Data is synchronized with the memory card, but it comes and I get the drivers to sync the phone. My contacts are at risk.It is a device to talk and have the convenience of dual simcard in a single device and Utilities standard: expansion card, bluetooth, camera, radio. Do not expect more than that.If you want anything, buy anything else. It will cost more $ $ $.Some mobile Chinese have the same performance and have TV and WiFi!! For the same price.

Reviews.Title: Touch Screen Basic 2 Sim Unlocked phone
Reviews.Author: kobia
Reviews.Content: Phone is exactly what I expected. I haven't traveled outside yet to see it function as unlocked. I think lots of its real abilities are hidden due to the unlock factor. However, its the most basic 2 sim card touch screen ever. Price to me is quite expensive. I will get another phone just in case otherwise phone is ok. Seller is awesome as usual and very nice timing on delivery and package came well packaged.

Reviews.Title: Quad Band Dual Simm unlocked mobile phones
Reviews.Author: DMDLINK
Reviews.Content: Be very-very carefull when you purchase the quad band dual simm card unlocked phones, even the ones made by Motorola and sold by the unlocked phones KIng, because no one can provide you with tech support assistance how to configure the phones. Not Motorola, nor your mobile service provider or the seller who will direct you to call Motorola Tech Support and the Motorola tech support will direct you to call Motorola tech support in India!!!!! Actually you paid all these money to buy a phone that its only function is to make calls, forget all about the things that you can do with a smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Buen producto
Reviews.Author: Alejandro B
Reviews.Content: El producto es bueno, para ser de doble SIM trabaja correctamente con ambas tarjetas, la intefaz grafica podría ser mejor, y faltan algunas opciones como mayor facilidad de personalizar llamadas, ringtones para personas y para cada SIM. Es un poco dificil encontrar manos libres compatible puesto que dicen que cualquiera funciona, pero en la realidad no es asi. Buen sonido

Reviews.Title: In a way, disappointed.
Reviews.Author: drea
Reviews.Content: The call quality is awful. Can't text without the stylus. touch screen not very responsive. annoying phone to own. I am returning it.

Reviews.Title: No funciona con el Motorola Phone Tools
Reviews.Author: Jaime Andrade
Reviews.Content: Pareciera el hermano bastardo que nadie quiere, no es compatible con el Motorola Phone Tools al igual que el EX115. Este si vino es español.

Reviews.Title: Es incomodo escribir SMS
Reviews.Author: Arreaza Sanez Arturo Alejandro
Reviews.Content: Este equipo posee todo lo que un telefono celular moderno de gama media puede ofrecer la camara es buena, soporta memoria expandible, soporta dos lineas, tiene grabador de voces, de conversaciones pero el asunto se complica al momento de redactar un simple mensaje de texto ya que en primer lugar el software solo viene en 4 lenguajes (ingles y otros tres indues o asiaticos) no posee texto predictivo y si lo tuviera no esta la opcion de utilizarlo en español y el teclado qwerty es realmente incomodo de utilizar con teclas muy pequeña haciendo muy lenta la escritura

Reviews.Title: exelente producto. Gracias Motorola
Reviews.Author: MiguelM
Reviews.Content: funciona muy bien con las dos tarjetas simcard, la recepción de señal y sonido es excelente.Por fin un teléfono de doble simcard de buena marca y bien hecho.La duración de la batería es apenas aceptable teniendo presente que por tener doble simcard, el consumo de energía es mayor.

3.2-inch TFT LCD display
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint; Motorola,Quadband,Bluetooth,Touch Screen, Dual Sim
Dual SIM Standby, Stereo FM radio with RDS,
MP3/WAV/eAAC+ player,Organizer,Voice memo,
Predictive text input,SMS, MMS, Email, memory Card slot
ProductInfo.Name: Motorola EX128 Unlocked Phone with Dual-Sim and Touchscreen - International Warranty - Silver
